perturbation.original_text: The parties desire to work cooperatively, but independently, to use commercially reasonable efforts to engage in the marketing and promotional activities described in Exhibit A, including, but not limited to Zynga promoting the WPT brand in a WPT-branded Zynga Poker Tournament Mode, and WPT promoting the Zynga brand in WPT Tournaments and WPT Invitational Tournaments.
perturbation.changed_text: The parties desire to work cooperatively, but independently, to engage in the marketing and promotional activities described in Exhibit A, including, but not limited to Zynga promoting the WPT brand in a WPT-branded Zynga Poker Tournament Mode, and WPT promoting the Zynga brand in WPT Tournaments and WPT Invitational Tournaments.
perturbation.explanation: The phrase 'commercially reasonable efforts' has been removed. This shifts the commitment from a standard legally defined and understood to a potentially lower, undefined standard. This creates uncertainty as to what level of effort is required, contradicting the original intent and potentially leading to unenforceability of this clause under contract law.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract Law - Standard of Performance (Implied Duty of Good Faith and Fair Dealing)

perturbation.original_text: Annual Minimum Guarantee. Zynga will pay WPT three million U.S. dollars ($3,000,000) per year according to the following schedule (which the parties may alter upon mutual agreement) (the "Annual Minimum Guarantee")
perturbation.changed_text: Annual Recommended Payment. Zynga will pay WPT three million U.S. dollars ($3,000,000) per year according to the following schedule (which the parties may alter upon mutual agreement) (the "Annual Recommended Payment")
perturbation.explanation: The term 'Annual Minimum Guarantee' has been replaced with 'Annual Recommended Payment.' This undermines the obligatory nature of the payment. A 'guarantee' has a specific legal meaning, implying a firm commitment. 'Recommended Payment' suggests it is optional, directly contradicting the purpose of a minimum guarantee and creating a legal contradiction. This introduces ambiguity about the financial obligations, potentially making this section unenforceable as written.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract Law - Enforceability of Payment Terms

perturbation.original_text: Each party agrees to carry liability insurance sufficient to cover the risks posed under this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: Each party agrees to attempt to obtain liability insurance.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause mandates that each party 'carry liability insurance sufficient to cover the risks' in the agreement. This has been changed to only requiring parties to 'attempt to obtain liability insurance.' This creates ambiguity and potentially voids the original clause. The original clause created clear obligations while the modified text is vague and may only require the parties to inquire about liability insurance.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract Law - Duty to Preform Contract in Good Faith
